entry.title: maplibre/maplibre-compose
entry.summary:
Add interactive vector tile maps to your Compose app

MapLibre for Compose Multiplatform

Introduction

MapLibre Compose is a Compose Multiplatform wrapper around the MapLibre SDKs for rendering interactive maps. You can use it to add maps to your Compose UIs across Android, iOS, Desktop, and Web.

Usage

  • Getting Started
  • API Reference
  • Demo App

Status

A large subset of MapLibre's features are already supported, but the full breadth of the MapLibre SDKs is not yet covered. What is already supported may have bugs. API stability is not yet guaranteed; we're still exploring how best to express an interactive map API in Compose.

See the status table for a breakdown of supported features on each platform. Android and iOS have the most complete support, while Desktop and Web are still catching up.

entry.title: gemwalletcom/gem-android
entry.summary:
Gem - Open Source Android Crypto Wallet

üíé Gem Wallet - Android

Gem Wallet is a powerful and secure mobile application designed for Android and iOS. It provides users with a seamless and intuitive experience to manage their digital assets and cryptocurrencies.

The app is developed using Kotlin/Compose. The codebase also includes a Core library implemented in Rust, providing efficient and secure cryptographic operations for enhanced data protection.

ü§ñ Android available on the Google Play Store

üì≤Ô∏è iOS available on the App Store

‚ú® Features

  • üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Open Source & Community Owned with web3 ethos.
  • üóùÔ∏è Self-Custody Exclusive ownership and access to funds.
  • üîë Secure and Privacy preserving wallet.
  • üîó Multi-Chain Support: Supports Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Avalanche, Solana, and more.
  • üîÑ Swaps: Exchange cryptocurrencies quickly and easily.
  • üìà Staking: Earn rewards by staking assets.
  • üåê WalletConnect: Secure communication with decentralized applications (dApps).
  • üåç Fiat On/Off Ramp: Easily convert between cryptocurrencies and traditional currencies.
  • üóÉÔ∏è Backup and Recovery: Simple backup and recovery options.
  • üìà Real-Time Market Data: Integrated with real-time price tracking and market data.
  • üîÑ Instant Transactions: Fast and efficient transactions with low fees.
  • üîî Customizable Notifications: Set alerts for transactions, price changes, and important events.
  • üõ°Ô∏è Advanced Security: Encryption and secure key management.

üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Contributing

  • Look in to our Github Issues
  • See progress on our Github Project Board
  • Public Roadmap

See our Contributing Guidelines.

ü•∞ Community

  • Install the app Gem Wallet
  • Join our Discord
  • Follow on Twitter or join Telegram

üôã Getting Help

  • Join the support Telegram to get help, or
  • Open a discussion with your question, or
  • Open an issue with the bug

If you want to contribute, you can use our developers telegram to chat with us about further development!

üöÄ Getting Started

Android Development

[!NOTE]
We recommend using Apple silicon Macs for development (arm64), if you're using Intel Mac, you need to add x86_64 to targets under cargoNdk in build.gradle.kts.

  1. Download and install latest Android Studio
  2. Install JDK 17, preferably using SDKMAN
  3. Install just by running brew install just if you don't have it already.
  4. Run just bootstrap to install all nessesary tools (Rust / NDK).
  5. Generate a GitHub personal token with read:packages permission and add it to your local.properties file:
gpr.username=<your-github-username>
gpr.token=<your-github-personal-token>

Optionally, you can generate models and kotlin bindgen by running just generate, Gem Android consumes wallet core library as a local module, if you need to update it, ping us or create an issue on here.

üë®‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Contributors

We love contributors! Feel free to contribute to this project but please read the Contributing Guidelines first!

üåç Localization

Join us in making our app accessible worldwide! Contribute to localization efforts by visiting our Lokalise project
